headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Bible in Our Common Schools and the Loss of the Arctic. Trial of Jerome B. King for the Murder of Peter G. Post. MURDER TRIALS. More Nominations Coming. The Military. Attempt at Arson. Meeting of the Baptist Historical Society. Death of Edwin Williams--St. David's Benovolent Society. COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS. COLLISION-- SICKNESS ON VESSELS.-- UNIVERSITY OF NEW-YORK-- Arrest of the Proprietors of an Extensive Slaughter-House.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Sermon on "Character, Responsibilities, and Consequences, as illustrated by the wreck of the Arctic," was preached on Sunday evening, by Rev. Dr. CHEEVER, in the Church of the Puritans, Union square, before a crowded audience.
docs.snippet: A Sermon on "Character, Responsibilities, and Consequences, as illustrated by the wreck of the Arctic," was preached on Sunday evening, by Rev. Dr. CHEEVER, in the Church of the Puritans, Union square, before a crowded audience.

headline.main: LATE FROM MEXICO.; Conspiracies and Plot--Mr. Gadsen in Trouble.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Orizaba, arrived yesterday morning, having left Vera Cruz on the 10th inst. The Orizaba was detained by a heavy norther. By this arrival we have our usual files of papers from Vera Cruz to the 8th, and from the city of Mexico to the 5th inst. The following letter from our attentive correspondent will be read with interest: Correspondence of the Bee.

headline.main: A Drouth that Helps the Land.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is a time of dreadful drouth for the old Sonkers of Connecticut. Their Liquor Law is as 'stringent as persimmons. A striped pig can't breaths Connecticut air any better than he could charcoal fumes.
docs.snippet: It is a time of dreadful drouth for the old Sonkers of Connecticut. Their Liquor Law is as 'stringent as persimmons. A striped pig can't breaths Connecticut air any better than he could charcoal fumes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Fire in Williamsburg--Loss about $18,000. A fire broke out in the brass foundry of VOORKIES DAVIS, in Seventh-street, near Division avenue, shortly after 12 o'clock, Saturday morning The alarm was given, and the firemen were early on the ground but owing to the inconvenience of water, some time elapsed before a stream was brought to bear upon the flames, and the building, together with to contents, was entirely destroyed.
